intro: Silene czopandagensis, commonly known as the Czopandagen's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Silene czopandagensis is known for its small, lance-shaped leaves and its ability to bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
